title.narrative: PE Optimization of Lima Water and Sewerage Systems

description.narrative: The proposed development objective of this project is to improve efficiency, continuity and reliability of water supply and sanitation services in the Northern Area of Lima.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Loan Agreement Article V, 5.01 (a) | Description :The Subsidiary Agreement has been executed on behalf of theBorrower and the Project Implementing Entity. | Due Date :13-Oct-2011

Finance Agreement :Loan Agreement Article V, 5.01 (b) | Description :The Operational Manual, in form and substance satisfactory tothe Bank, has been adopted by the Project Implementing Entity througha managerial resolution. | Due Date :13-Oct-2011

Finance Agreement :Project AgreementSchedule, Section II.B.2 | Description :The Project Implementing Entity shall contract theauditors for purposes of Section 5.09(b) of the General Conditions, under terms of reference acceptable to the Bank. | Frequency:Yearly

Finance Agreement :Project AgreementSchedule, Section III.B | Description :The Project Implementing Entity shall contract annualindependent procurement reviews for previous year of Project implementation and furnish to the Bank the report of such independentreviews. | Frequency :Yearly

title.narrative: Number of water utilities that the project is supporting
Number of stakholders (men and women) reached with information on rational water use, including information on water saving equipment
Number of people (men and women) participating in learning events on strategic planning and management
Piped household water connections that are benefiting from rehabilitation works undertaken by the project
Annual incidence of water pipe breakages per km of water supply network in the project area.
Number of daily hours water services are provided in the project area.
Percentage reduction in Non Revenue Water (% of volume invoiced/volume distributed)
Annual incidence of sewerage blockages per km of sewerage network in the project area.
Evaluation of current and future demand for water and sanitation services completed together with identification of priority actions to meet such demand as efficiently as possible.
Action plan completed for the integration of GIS and SCADA systems.
Study on options for the development of a new organizational model completed.
No. of schools reached with information on rational water use, including information on water saving equipment
Integrated Non-Revenue Water management Action Plan elaborated and approved by SEDAPAL's General Management and Board
